gurmukhi: kro boD mwqM ]imlXo Pyir BRwqM ]sunXo BrQ Dwey ]pgM sIs lwey ]675]
transliteration: Daro Bodh Maatan|| Milyo Pher(i) Bhraatan|| Sounyo Bharath Dhaae|| Pagadg Sees Laae||675||
translation: He pacified his mother in this way and then he met his brother Bharat. Bharat on hearing his arrival ran towards him and touched his head with the feet of Ram.675.

gurmukhi: Bry rwm AMkM ]imtI srb sMkM ]imlXM s`qR hMqw ]srM swsqR gMqw ]676]
transliteration: Bhare Raam Aaakan|| Mitisarab Sankan|| Milyo Sattra Hantaa|| Saran Saastra Hantaa|| Saran Saastra Gadtaa||676||
translation: Ram hugged him to his bosom and cleared all the doubts; then he met Shatrugan, who had expert knowledge of weapons and Shastras.676.

gurmukhi: jtM DUr JwrI ]pgM rwm rwrI ]krI rwj Arcw ]idjM byd crcw ]677]
transliteration: Jatan Dhoor Jhdaree|| Pagadg Raam Rdaree|| Kariraaj Archaa|| Dijan Bed Charchaa||677||
translation: The brothers cleansed the dust from the feet and matted hair of Ram. They worlshipped him in royal way and the Brahmins recited the Vedas.677.

gurmukhi: krYN gIq gwnM ]Bry vIr mwnM ]dIXM rwm rwjM ]sry srb kwjM ]678]
transliteration: Darain Geet Gadnan|| Bhare Veer Maanan|| Deeyo Raam Raajan|| Dare Sarab Kaajan||678||
translation: All the brothers sang full of love. Ram was made the king and all the works were completed in this way.678.

gurmukhi: bulY ib`p lIny ]sRu`qocwr kIny ]Bey rwm rwjw ]bjy jIq bwjw ]679]
transliteration: Bulai Bipp Leene|| Srouttochaar Keene|| Bhae Raam Raajaa|| Bade Jeet Baajaa||679||
translation: The Brahmins were called in and with the recitation of Vedic mantras Ram was enthroned; on all the four sides resounded the musical instruments denoting victory.679.

gurmukhi: chUM c`k ky C`qR DwrI bulwey ]Dry A`qR nIky purI AauD Awey ]
transliteration: Chahoon Chakk Ke Chhattra Dhaaribulaae|| Ddare Attra Neeke Puriaudh Aae||
translation: The sovereigns were called from all the four directions and they all reached Avadhpuri

gurmukhi: ghy rwm pwXM prm pRIq kY kY ]imly c`qR dysI bfI Byt dY kY ]680]
transliteration: Gade Raam Paayan Param Preet Kai Kai|| Mile Chattra Desibadibhet Dai Kai||680||
translation: They all fell at the feet of Ram, exhibiting their supreme love and met him with great presents.680.

gurmukhi: dey cIn mwcIn cInMq dysM ]mhwN suMdRI cyrkw cwr kysM ]
transliteration: Dae Cheen Maacheen Cheenant Desan|| Mahaan Soundricherkaa Chaar Kesan||
translation: The kings presented gifts from various and beautiful maidens of elegant hair.

gurmukhi: mnM mwnkM hIr cIrM AnykM ]kIey Kyj p`eIXY khUM eyk eykM ]681]
transliteration: Manan Maanakan Heer Chderan Anekan|| Keee Khoj Paeeyai Kahoon Ek Ekan||681||
translation: They also presented rare gems. Jewels and garments 681.

gurmukhi: mnM mu`qIXM mwnkM bwj rwjM ]dey dMqpMqI sjy srb swjM ]
transliteration: Manan Moutteeyan Maanakan Baaj Raajan|| Dae Dant-pantisaje Sarab Saajan||
translation: They presented winsome horses, jewels, gems, pearls as well as elephants;

gurmukhi: rQM bystM hIr cIrM AnMqM ]mnM mwnkM b`D r`DM durMqM ]682]
transliteration: Rathan Bestan Heer Chderan Anantan|| Manan Maanakan Baddh Raddhan Durantan||682||
translation: The chariots, diamonds, raiments and invaluable precious stones were also presented.682.

gurmukhi: ikqy sy√çq AYrwvqM qu`il dMqI ]dey mu`qXM swj s`jy supMqI ]
transliteration: Kite Svet Airaavtan Tull(i) Dantee|| Dae Mouttayan Saaj Sajje Soupantee||
translation: Somewhere the whit elephants bedecked with gems are being presented;

gurmukhi: ikqy bwj rwjM jrI jIn sMgM ]ncY n`t mwno mcy jMg rMgM ]683]
transliteration: Kite Baaj Raajaan Jarijeen Sanadg|| Nachai Natt Maano Mache Jan Ranadg||683||
translation: Somewhere the horses tightened with brocaded thick cloth are dancing exhibiting a spectacle of war. 683.
